entry.def: If someone fabricates information, they invent it in order to deceive people.

example.ex: All four claim that officers fabricated evidence against them...
example.tran: 4 人全都声称警察捏造证据陷害他们。

example.ex: Eleven key officials were hanged on fabricated charges.
example.tran: 11位高官因莫须有的罪名被处以绞刑。

entry.def: If something is fabricated from different materials or substances, it is made out of those materials or substances.

example.ex: All the tools are fabricated from high quality steel.
example.tran: 所有工具均由精钢制成。
一家制造飞机配件的工厂

means.word_mean: 1. formed or conceived by the imagination;

auth_sentence.content: So are MEMs devices fabricated or operated in vacuum?
auth_sentence.res_content: So are MEMs devices fabricated or operated in vacuum?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So are MEMs devices fabricated or operated in vacuum?

auth_sentence.content: Call it organic, as opposed to fabricated, culture.
auth_sentence.res_content: Call it organic, as opposed to fabricated, culture.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Call it organic, as opposed to fabricated, culture.

auth_sentence.content: But they appear unconvincing and could easily have been fabricated.
auth_sentence.res_content: But they appear unconvincing and could easily have been fabricated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But they appear unconvincing and could easily have been fabricated.

sentences.en: From Hollywood to fabricated prime-time reality, this spotlight-dependent species is thriving.
sentences.cn: 从好莱坞到虚构的黄金时段的虚拟现实，这种依赖聚光灯生存的人越来越多，正茁壮成长。
